title: Executive Order 8437-Power Site Restoration No. 493. Partial Revocation of Executive Order of November 22, 1924, Creating Power Site Reserve No. 759
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the act of June 25, 1910, ch. 421, 36 Stat. 847, the Executive Order of November 22, 1924, creating Power Site Reserve No. 759, is hereby revoked as to the following-described lands:

T. 12 S., R. 20 W.,     sec. 1, lot 4, SW¼NW¼ , and SW¼;     sec. 3, W½;     sec. 4, NE¼;     sec. 10, W½E½, and E½W½;     sec. 15, W½E½ , E½W½, and SE¼SE¼;     sec. 22, W½E½, and W½;     sec. 23, E½SE¼ ;     sec. 24, SW¼;     sec. 26, NE¼NE¼, S½NE¼, NE¼SW¼, S½SW¼, and SE¼;     sec. 27, N½ and SW¼;     sec. 28, E½ and SW¼;     sec. 29, S½;     sec. 30, S½SW¼, and SE¼;     sec. 31, NW¼, and S½SE¼;     sec. 32, S½S½;     sec. 33, S½S½;     sec. 34, S½S½;     sec. 35, N½NW¼, and S½SW¼.
T. 13 S., R. 20 W.,     sec. 3, NW¼;     sec. 4, N½ ;     sec. 5, N½, and N½S½;     sec. 6, all.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8437-Power Site Restoration No. 493. Partial Revocation of Executive Order of November 22, 1924, Creating Power Site Reserve No. 759 Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/371934
